questions.prompt: What are the names (first names acceptable) of the villainous duo of dastardly spies from the television land of Pottsylvania?
1889's Three Men in a Boat is a classic by an English novelist, playwright, and humorist whose first and last names are the same. His middle initial is K—what is that first/last name?
Aspirin, ibuprofen, codeine, and morphine are drugs used to relieve pain in a class known by what name (from the Greek for "without pain")?

What is the name of the song, first published with this title in The Atlantic Monthly in 1862, whose lyrics contain the line "He is trampling out the vintage where the grapes of wrath are stored" and repeat three times in its chorus the line "Glory, glory, hallelujah!"?
In the classic standard version of the game Monopoly, what is the color of the $1 note?
East of the Ashanti Plateau, the River Volta is dammed as it approaches the Gold Coast and the Atlantic Ocean, forming Lake Volta, the largest body of water in what nation?
